file_content.text: Oh, thank the stars. Give me a hand! I can't lift it off them!
The flame smells wrong. Tread lightly, Herald.
The others are all--we're the only ones left!
Help! The heat--I'm burning! Help! Help me!
Trust in the Force. I won't let any harm come to you.
Don't be afraid. [Lift]
Relax. You're safe now, I'll get you out of there.
Hold on. [Lift]
Lucky for you, you're my best hope to find Master Tykan.
I need you alive. [Lift]
You're a Jedi? Please, get Laria out!
And the Jedi holocrons, Tal! Their medical data could save millions! We have to preserve them!
No artifacts are worth endangering someone's life.
The woman first. [Lift]
To let Laria perish would betray the very order behind those holocrons.
Jedi help people. [Lift]
The holocrons are gone! You fool, what have you done?
Saved my life, doctor. You'd have let me die! And on top of Tykan trying to kill us!
If it means saving so many, then this knowledge must be preserved.
The holocrons first. [Lift]
Please! Tal! Help me, I--I--ahhhhh!
Laria! How could you? Jedi are meant to help people!
This holocron data could help millions. But I regret Laria became one with the Force to save them.
I am.
I would have saved Laria, too. I never had the chance.
I wanted to help her.
You have no idea what it feels like to make these decisions.
Don't question me.
My Laria... I've lost her.
I'm so sorry, Tal. But those holocrons could give us cures for hundreds of diseases. Tykan might have killed entire planets, instead of just us.
You're saying Master Tykan was responsible for this?
Tykan?
Start from the beginning.
Setting yourselves on fire, losing half your expedition... what a disgrace.
You're all useless.
I agree, but your Jedi Master is the one responsible for it!
We were taking pollution readings in the ruins. But when we found those medical holocrons, we decided to get them back right away.
On the way home, Tykan lures us into a trapfall, ignites the pollution in the swamp and stands there watching us burn!
I can't imagine a Jedi Master doing such a thing.
This doesn't make sense.
I don't understand any of this either.
Master Tykan is unwell. He's not himself.
He has the plague.
Brilliant deduction, Jedi. Tykan had some wisdom for us, too.
Tykan had quite the elegant strategy.
That's a clever plan.
If you like that, you'll love what he did next.
Oh, I'm glad you approve. And he didn't stop there.
Tykan said he was punishing us for letting Taris be destroyed, centuries ago! And that soon we would be joined by "everyone at the Junction."
The Junction's an old purification facility the Republic retrofitted to process dangerous gases.
Hundreds of people work at the Junction. If Master Tykan is planning something....
I won't allow Tykan to hurt anyone else. I promise.
I can save them.
You mean the way Laria got hurt? Save it.
I have the power to stop him.
Wish it had been ours.
I have to stop Tykan. Whatever the cost.
Tykan's my priority.
So destroying precious holocrons was a mere warm-up, hmm?
Hmph. Someone as ruthless as you might stand a chance.
We'll start back to the base--we'll be okay. Thank you for saving my life.
Just don't underestimate Tykan. That man is dangerous.
We'll get these holocrons back to the base for a proper study. Here. For your trouble.
Enjoy it while you can, Jedi. Maybe Tykan will find a place in the swamp for you, too.
Usually my first thought when I find intriguing technology. Especially if there's a, er, "dispute of ownership."
Well, people should know better than to keep a genius from his craft.
